subject: Re: [junit] Ants, Ants, everywhere!
msgSnippet: ... Thanks, I just subscribed. ... I goofed up too. I added in the throws new BuildException(), and rebuilt my DixieCheck class, but I forgot to move it to the
messageBody:
Jason Rogers wrote:
>
> > Is the Ant user list under yahoogroups or is it
> > elsewhere? I'd like to
> > browse that list too.
>
> No. Just go to the Ant homepage at Jakarta. There is a link for
> subscribing to the user list (http://jakarta.apache.org/site/mail.html) as
> well as browsing the archives
> (http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=ant-user&r=1&w=2).

Thanks, I just subscribed.



> > > 'haltonfailure=yes' and/or 'haltonerror=yes' should work here.
> >
> > Hmmm. I tried both of these and it says that the
> > attributes are not
> > supported
> > by this task I've created.
>
> You have to add those attributes specifically to your script. What I was
> referring to was running the <junit/> task that supports these attributes.
> Miscommunication...

I goofed up too. I added in the throws new BuildException(), and rebuilt
my
DixieCheck class, but I forgot to move it to the Ant lib\optional area
so
it was using an older copy. With the correct version, a failure stops
the
build process. So, I can run without the mail server running and the
build
will stop. With the server running, the build works. I didn't need to
add
any attribute support in my DixieCheck class or anything.



> Ant has a very nice documentation package. There is a doc/ directory in
> your Ant install_dir.

Yeah, I checked it out and it didn't have very much on how to make ones
own
task (especially with some fancier options). The JavaDoc stuff is great,
I
just don't know where to look in the class tree for the information I
need :^)


> > I was thinking of two ways to kick off the server
> ...
> [some useful info deleted]...
>
> Let's take it off-line if you need more help.

Yeah, I'll send you e-mail, as I'd like to know how to do this. I'll
post a
summary to the news group, if there is any interest.


Thanks for your help, I'm getting closer.
